Hi Gordon,
Thank you for your quick response. I did as you said and it work=
ed,
Thanks a lot.

About multiple queuing(question 2):
I read at the Heritr=
ix 3 new features that it has:
"# Introduction of parallel queues.  When cr=
awling specific sites that can handle large amounts of traffic, the paralle=
l queues option can be used to open many concurrent crawling connections to=
 a single site."

meaning if I want to crawl only a specific site by multip=
le connections how can I do it? 

Thanks a lot!

--- In archive-crawler@yah=
oogroups.com, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
> On 12/16/10 1:39 AM, yotp=
o.official wrote:
> > Hi,
> > I'm pretty new to Heritrix 3 and despite my v=
ery good impression of the code and it's ability, I'm having problems with =
a couple of things:
> >
> > 1. How do I config the cxml file so I will craw=
l only in a specific domain, lets say http://example.com and only in sub do=
mains of it?
> > meaning if there is a url ads.google/.... i dont want to e=
ven fetch it.
> 
> See the first Frequently-Asked-Question listed on the pr=
oject wiki, 
> 'unexpected offsite content':
> 
> https://webarchive.jira.c=
om/wiki/display/Heritrix/FAQs
> 
> > 2. How do i make the multiple queuing =
to work? does it happens automatically?
> 
> What do you mean by "multiple =
queueing"?
> 
> > 3. I configed the cxml file so I wont process all the jpg=
/gif/png files but my logs still show me (Mimetypes) i process them.  this =
is what I did:
> > <bean class=3D"org.archive.modules.deciderules.MatchesLi=
stRegexDecideRule">
> >            <property name=3D"decision" value=3D"REJ=
ECT"/>
> >       <!--<property name=3D"listLogicalOr" value=3D"true" />  --=
>
> >       <!--<property name=3D"regexList">
> >             <list>
> >   =
                <value>.*(?i)(\.css(\?.*)?)$</value>
> >                   =
<value>.*(\.bmp|\.gif|\.jpg|\.png|bmp))$</value>
> >             </list>
> =
>            </property>  -->
> >      </bean>
> >
> > what is my mistake??=

> 
> A definite problem is that your 'regexList' property element is insid=
e 
> XML comment markers -- "<!-- ... -->" -- so is not a part of the activ=
e 
> configuration.
> 
> A possible problem could be the relative location =
of this rule with 
> respect to other scope rules; if this comes early, but=
 then a later rule 
> ACCEPTs the same URIs, the later rule wins.
> 
> You =
regexes also seem a bit suboptimal -- the CSS part could be mixed in 
> wit=
h the others, BMP doesn't need to be listed twice, you may want the 
> case=
-insensitive indicator for all suffixes, etc. -- but looks vaguely 
> funct=
ional for your purposes.
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
>
